function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Limited application of guidelines may lead to inadequate disease mitigation measures in residential buildings.","Impact":"Increased risk of disease transmission and compromised public health.","Mitigation":"Thorough assessment of building typologies and modification of guidelines for diverse housing structures.","Technologies":"Adaptive building designs and ventilation systems for improved air quality.","People":"Residents, visitors, and the public health community.","Owner":"Architects, urban planners, and public health authorities."},{"Description":"Limited access to common areas in dense urban areas may hinder the implementation of disease mitigation measures.","Impact":"Reduced ability to implement guidelines for disease control and prevention in residential buildings.","Mitigation":"Development of alternative entry and access points for common areas, utilizing technology for contactless access.","Technologies":"Digital access control systems, smart locks, and remote monitoring.","People":"Residents, urban planners, and building management.","Owner":"Property developers, building owners, and urban planning authorities."},{"Description":"Lower application rate of the resilient residential model may result in suboptimal disease resilience during the pandemic and beyond.","Impact":"Decreased effectiveness of disease control measures and prolonged vulnerability of residents to future pandemics.","Mitigation":"Education and incentivization programs to encourage widespread adoption of the resilient residential model, emphasizing its benefits for public health.","Technologies":"Informational campaigns, community engagement platforms, and virtual reality simulations.","People":"Residents, community leaders, and public health advocates.","Owner":"Government agencies, community organizations, and housing associations."}]}
